tool_description: Direct access to simulated spatially enabled traffic grids of urban regions.
name: geourban
title: geourban

api_list.name: query
api_list.description:
Queries the simulated agent positions in space and time.
Returns all positions within a certain radius of a given location and within a certain time frame.

required_parameters.name: vehicle
required_parameters.description: Car, Bike and Pedestrian are possible vehicle types.

required_parameters.name: lon
required_parameters.description: The longitude coordinate of the location.

required_parameters.name: datetime
required_parameters.description: Represents the simulated date and time. The query endpoint returns the simulated agents locations for this specific time. The value must be defined using ISO format.

required_parameters.name: lat
required_parameters.description: The latitude coordinate of the location.

optional_parameters.name: seconds
optional_parameters.description: The duration of the time frame defined in seconds. The maximum duration is 120 seconds.

optional_parameters.name: meters
optional_parameters.description: The planar distance/radius in meters defining the area of interest. The maximum distance is 1000 meters.

optional_parameters.name: format
optional_parameters.description: The values esri and geojson are supported output formats.

api_list.name: simulations
api_list.description: Returns all the available simulations using the urban region and the simulation date.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://geourban.p.rapidapi.com/simulations"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "geourban.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://geourban.p.rapidapi.com/simulations"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "geourban.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: aggregate
api_list.description: Returns a spatially enabled traffic grid representing aggregated simulated movements of pedestrians, bikes and cars.

required_parameters.name: region
required_parameters.description: The simulations endpoint returns all available urban regions. You have to use the region code, e.g. *DEA22* for the city of Bonn, Germany.

required_parameters.name: grid
required_parameters.description:
The values *agent*, *speed* and *emissions* are supported grid types.
*agent*: The number of unique agents is calculated.
*speed*: The speed average of every agent is calculated.
*emissions*: The sum of carbon dioxide emissions of every agent is calculated. This makes only sense for vehicle being cars!

required_parameters.name: format
required_parameters.description: The values *esri* and *geojson* are supported output formats.

required_parameters.name: time
required_parameters.description: Represents the simulated start time. The simulations endpoint list the available urban regions with their simulation dates. The time must be defined using the simulation date and the time being on the hour, e.g. *2023-08-24T07:00:00*.

api_list.name: top
api_list.description: Returns the top most accumulated traffic grid cells for an urban region.

required_parameters.name: date
required_parameters.description: Represents the simulated date. The simulations endpoint list the available urban regions with their simulation dates. The date must be defined using ISO format, e.g. *2023-08-24*.

required_parameters.name: region
required_parameters.description: The simulations endpoint returns all available urban regions. You have to use the region code, e.g. *DEA22* for the city of Bonn, Germany.

required_parameters.name: grid
required_parameters.description:
The values *agent*, *speed* and *emissions* are supported grid types.
*agent*: The number of unique agents is calculated.
*speed*: The speed average of every agent is calculated.
*emissions*: The sum of carbon dioxide emissions of every agent is calculated. This makes only sense for vehicle being cars!

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: The maximum number of returned features.

optional_parameters.name: format
optional_parameters.description: The values *esri* and *geojson* are supported output formats.
